thread.title: New GOP front-runner makes Iowa visit to promote his book
thread.title_full: New GOP front-runner makes Iowa visit to promote his book

title: New GOP front-runner makes Iowa visit to promote his book
text:
New GOP front-runner makes Iowa visit to promote his book Published 5:28 PM CDT Oct 24, 2015 
(Photo: Kim St. Onge/KCCI) Photos 
New GOP front-runner Ben Carson, who surpassed rival Donald Trump in this week’s Quinnipiac and Des Moines Register polls, made a low-key campaign stop in Iowa Saturday. Other Stories Firefighters battle blaze at auto... 
About 600 people waited in line for hours at the Barnes and Noble bookstore in West Des Moines to meet Carson, who was signing his book “A More Perfect Union.” 
Though no political rally was held, he did answer questions from the crowd. Most responses were quick with just enough time to shake hands and snap a picture. 
When asked how he’s feeling now that he’s the new Republican front-runner, Carson responded, “You know, I’m not going to get overly excited because I realize that the election is still 13 months away. But I’d rather be at the top than at the bottom of the polls.” 
Carson will continue his book tour in Iowa, making stops in Waterloo and Dubuque.
